title: Textile, 1983-4-1, 18th century
medium:
Medium: silk

Technique: Predominately warp-caced plain weave patterned by a continuous supplementary weft (white) and discontinuous supplementary wefts (multi-colors).  Supplementary wefts bound on the front in 1 3 twill.
dimensions:
Warp: 96 cm (38 in.)
Weft, selvedge to selvedge: 48.5 cm (19 1/8 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Vertically symmetrical pattern of exotic flowers loosely held together by an ogee foremat. Yellow background.
